intro: Holboellia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed habitats. Holboellia species are known for their rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. They are also used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants in some regions.
